How the well is suspended (which fluids used) is important. And probably better to bring it back on slowly. Wells with electrical submersible pumps (ESPs) tricky as ESPs don't like being stopped and restarted and are expensive to replace /4

Shale oil wells more problematic. Potential for loss of fracture conductivity, proppant, water hold-up and plugging by waxes, asphaltenes etc due to fluid incompatibility between different zones. Likely water-cut increases after restart /3
